channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA

item.title: Report X-2024061878
item.description:
Report X-2024061878

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-02T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Alexander Bretz, 042 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a UN1294, Toluene, 3, PG II spill on the dock floor. Alexander advised the forklift operator was attempting to load the drum when he punctured the drum with the forklift causing the spill. Safety asked if any struck the yard, and Alexander advised not yet. Safety asked if he would be able to contain the spill to the dock area. Alexander advised yes. Alex with CURA was contacted for remediation. Alexander contacted Safety advising approximately 5 Gallons struck the yard. Safety advised Cura regarding the spill to the yard.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON WET UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS 2 X 2.5 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES OF POWER LIQUID LIQUID MACHINE DETERGENT ONE 2.5 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLE HAD A LOOSE CAP ALLOWING .25 GALLONS TO RELEASE. NO SLOTTED PARTITIONS BAGS OR ABSORBENT WAS FOUND. FACILITY PROCEDUE FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS FOLLOWED CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWIATING DISPOSITIION

item.title: Report E-2024060667
item.description:
Report E-2024060667

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-26
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XHG experienced a UN1791 Dynachlor release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 30’ area of the trailer floor and concrete lot below due to a puncture caused by dunnage. The material was transferred into a new tote for shipment on. Absorbents and citric acid were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents were collected into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized into a 4th 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024061665
item.description:
Report X-2024061665

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package found leaking by package handler, 3481098, when she picked it up and felt it was wet on the bottom. She immediately reported it to her manager who flagged QA for inspection. She immediately washed her hands but reported residual tingling sensation while under stress. QA found during inspection one bottle sideways and having leaked.

item.title: Report E-2024060677
item.description:
Report E-2024060677

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: MCKEES ROCKS
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of material released from one (1) 5-gallon pail after a fall during loading/offloading. The released material impacted the concrete terminal floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents and recovered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 30-gallon poly drum along with the spent PPE and damaged pail. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: REPORTED TO DOOR 141. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID. BOX WAS ON THE ROLLER LINE. BOX WAS WET ON THE BOTTOM CORNER. NO LIQUID ON THE ROLLER LINE OR ON THE FLOOR UNDER IT. NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024060682
item.description:
Report E-2024060682

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: WOODLAND
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1-gallon of battery acid was released from three large batteries that were damaged during transit. The release impacted the trailer and asphalt dock. ERTS dispatched Miller Environmental Group to assist with cleanup. Miller Environmental Group deployed neutralizer, absorbents, and cleaned the impacted areas. The damaged batteries and recovered material was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024061426
item.description:
Report X-2024061426

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SHIPMENT TAKEN OUT OF SYSTEM FLOW DUE TO EXTERNAL CARTON WET UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS 4 X 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLES OF DEGREASER H.D. HEAVY DUTY CONCENTRATE ONE 1 GALLON PLASTIC BOTTLE HAD A LOOSE CAP ALLOWING .25 GALLONS TO RELEASE PACKAGE DID HAVE SLOTTED PARTITIONS BUT NO BAGS OR ABSORBENT WAS FOUND. FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS FOLLOWED CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION. PACKAGE HANDLER #2972155 DILLON FISHER WAS INJURYED BY PACKAGE DILLION PICKED UP THE PACKAGE AS IT CAME DOWN THE IC BELT NOT KNOWING THAT IT WAS A WET LEAKING HAZMAT GETTING THE LIQUID ON HIS HANDS.

  • Description: RESPONDER REPORTED TO DR 59 IN THE UNLOAD. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR CORROSIVE LIQUID. BOX WAS ON THE FLOOR IN THE TRAILER. BOX WAS WET ON THE SIDE, NO LIQUID ON THE FLOOR. NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
